channel.title: People can't connect to my server. - I am not a moron -
channel.description:
I have - Port Fowarded Tried without a router Tried uTorrent to open port Put ports in FireWall I have a No-Ip.
Any other Ideas? Maybe my ISP blocks it? Because I tried at my grandmas and friend house, who also both have centrurytel, and I can't get it to work there.
Also, I use this site to check and see if port is open, always fails -
http://canyouseeme.org/
Error: I could not see your service on My.Ip.Goes.Here on port (43594) Reason: Connection timed out

item.title: People can't connect to my server. - I am not a moron -
item.dc:creator: @0.o 0.o
item.description:
@0.o wrote:

My friend said I can just host it on his VPS server, problem solved =)

Read full topic

item.title: People can't connect to my server. - I am not a moron -
item.dc:creator: @Ckstunnerscape Ckstunner
item.description:
@Ckstunnerscape wrote:

[quote=“Hidendra, post:9, topic:229722”][quote author=Ckstunner link=topic=302284.msg2425370#msg2425370 date=1220570118]
Well, Apparently, They need you router in order to join the server, Did you update no-ip when you turn your server on ?
[/quote]
if you have modem -> pc with no router you do not need a router nor port forwarding, Ck.

have any other software that may block it? sorry, I normally use linux, not a huge winblows fan…[/quote]

Well, I know. If nothing that I tell you works, Sorry, I wouldn’t know, I use an Antenna.

Read full topic
item.source: People can't connect to my server. - I am not a moron -

item.title: People can't connect to my server. - I am not a moron -
item.dc:creator: @0.o 0.o
item.description:
@0.o wrote:

No antivirus, but I read this on centurytel’s site -

UPDATE: 09/12/2003 We are now blocking ICMP Types 0 and 8, and any ICMP with a 92 byte signature. Dependent on your application/operating system, this may affect your ability to ping or trace.

So maybe they are blocking it? Not sure what ICMP is.

Read full topic

Well, Apparently, They need you router in order to join the server, Did you update no-ip when you turn your server on ?

item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“Ckstunner, post:5, topic:229722”]Actually, It’s http://www.portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/routerindex.htm, Because most newbs will say, There is no thing called routers???

Then after you pick your router, click: 1st SMTP Server

It’s the very first one[/quote]

You use the Default router guide.

item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra

@hidendra wrote:

Have you tried following directions for your router model on http://portforward.com ? The guides here so to speak are a bit generic and won’t work for every router.

item.title: People can't connect to my server. - I am not a moron -
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Centurytel does not block port 43594. (quick google told me which ports they blocked)

Does your router have Block WAN Requests? Most Linksys routers do, if you have a Linksys that is… If so, turn it off. Some other routers probably have it as well.

Read full topic
